entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 4:12AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Periods of moderate to heavy rain continue for Seward area through Tuesday afternoon for the Seward area... The wet, active, onshore flow pattern continues several fronts and disturbances will impact the northern Gulf of Alaska coast over the next 48 hours. Expect another 1 to 2 inches of rain through early Wednesday

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 4:31AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Dense Fog possible for portions of the Tennessee Valley.. Patchy Dense Fog has developed across portions of DeKalb County, with visibilities dropping to 1/4 mile or less in isolated areas. Motorists are urged to drive with extreme caution, as visibilities will vary significantly given the patchy nature of the fog. Use low

entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR SOUTH FACING SHORES OF ALL ISLANDS BEGINNING MONDAY MORNING... .A south swell (190 degrees) will build tonight and bring surf heights to advisory level for south facing shores by Monday morning. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 5:29AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of Dense Fog Possible Early this Morning... Areas of dense fog have developed rapidly this morning over the Purchase Area of west Kentucky northward through much of southern Illinois along and west of the Interstate 57 and Interstate 24 corridor. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for a sudden reduction of visibility. Conditions should improve by 9 AM.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 12 at 4:07AM CDT until September 12 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Life threatening waves of 5 to 9 feet and dangerous currents are expected. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Sheboygan, and Ozaukee counties.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 12 at 3:56AM CDT until September 13 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Strong currents due to wave action. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Door, Kewaunee and Manitowoc Counties. * WHEN...Through this evening.

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued September 12 at 5:15AM EDT until September 12 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Portions of central, northern, northwest and western Virginia and panhandle West Virginia. * WHEN...Until 9 AM EDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 11:54AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Smoke From Wildfires Will Reduce Visibility And May Create Poor Air Quality... Multiple Wildfires in Oregon, Idaho, and Montana are producing high densities of smoke that is being blown into northern portions of Wyoming. Hazy skies and poor air quality are possible this afternoon and into tomorrow morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Absaroka Mountains; Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Yellowstone National Park
